data.text:
John Heard was convinced that Home Alone — the 1990 knockabout comedy that revolves around a family who go to Paris for the Christmas holiday and accidentally leave their eight-year-old son, Kevin, at home — would be a disaster. But he took the part of Peter McCallister, the frazzled and forgetful father anyway, because he thought that he might be able to take his son to work and that there would be other children for him to play with on set.
